headline.main: Commissioners of Health--Cargoes Can't be Lightered at the Lower Auchorage.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Commissioners of Health held a meeting on Monday afternoon, at the City Library Rooms, City Hall Present: Mossrs. Rockwell, Philips, Miller and Thompson. After the adoption of the minutes of the previous meeting, the following communication was received and read:
docs.snippet: The Commissioners of Health held a meeting on Monday afternoon, at the City Library Rooms, City Hall Present: Mossrs. Rockwell, Philips, Miller and Thompson. After the adoption of the minutes of the previous meeting, the following communication was...

docs.lead_paragraph: As sure as Brooklyn people go on board the Tenth-street Ferry when the wind is south or westerly, nine-tenths of them set to talking over the Board of Health and its purity. There is something in the air that suggests the topic. If it does not issue from the much talked of establishment at the foot of Division-avenne, it must come from Mr. CORNELL's dead-horse depot close by-the wharf of embarkation for Barren Island.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; Cotton Buoyant - Breadstuffs. Dull-Consols 92 3.8@92 1-2. THE AFRICAN LABOR QUESTION. GENERAL NEWS UNIMPORTANT. The Late Insurrections in Italy and Spain. Arrival of the Vanderbilt and Atlantic.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Vanderbilt, D. L. WILCOX, Esq., commanding, from Havre and Southampton at 8 P.M. on the 8 ult., with 120 passengers, $200,000 in specie and 1,000 tons merchandise, arrived at her dock at 11 o'clock yesterday morning.

headline.main: INTERESTING FROM MEXICO.; The Spanish War--Defensive Preparations--The Late Elections--The Insurrection at the South--General State of Political Affairs--Rumors of Another Sonora Expedition--Miscellaneous News.

docs.lead_paragraph: BY the Texas at New-Orleans we receive papers from the City of Mexico to the 3d and from Vera Cruz to the 7th inst. The absorbing question of the day, says the Trait d' Union, is the pending difficulty with Spain. Innu. merable rumors were in circulation, but the only thing positively known was that negotiations between the Spanish Government and the Mexican Envoy had been suspended. headline.main: THE EXECUTION OF D'ORSAY.; SCEN ES AT TH E TOMBS. HIS DYING STATEMENTS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The negro, JOHN D'ORSAY, was executed yes terday morning, within the limits of the City Prison for the murder of ANN McGIVEN, alias Anne Hopkins, a woman of the town, in Worth-street, a few months since. The execution was witnessed by a few, and was conducted in good order.

headline.main: An Important Survey. From the Sioux City Eagle.

headline.main: Triennial Festival of the Alumni of Harvard.; Speeches of Messrs. Winthrap, Josiah Quincy and Lord Napier, and Poem of Oliver Wondell Holmes. We published yesterday the oration of Hon.

docs.lead_paragraph: We published yesterday the oration of Hon. EDWARD EVRBETT delivered before the Alumni of Hon. Edward on Thursday, and now give from the Boston Traveller the continuation of the day's proceedings. The festival tables in Harvard Hall were arranged not as at the last Triennial Festival of the Alumni, but with the President's table directly opposite the door.

headline.main: QUARRELS IN THE POLICE COMMISSION.; Curious Revelations Among the New, and New Devices of the Old Police. THE SPECIALS DISMISSED. No. 88 White-street Unroofed. SIMEON DRAPER RESIGNS. What the Troubles are---President Draper's Statement. MR. STRANAHAN'S WITHDRAWAL POSSIBLE.

docs.lead_paragraph: SIMEON DRAPER yesterday resigned to Gov. KING his position as head of the Metropolitan Police. The news created very general surprise. There had been no previous indication of such a step, and under the existing circumstances-the public mind unusually excited, and thieves and vagabonds and pre. judiced men openly defying the Police-such a step on the part of the President of the Board was looked upon with alarm.
